1.verse: James, ( A ) a servant of God ( B ) and of the Lord Jesus Christ,

2.verse: Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters,  whenever you face trials of many kinds, ( F )

3.verse: because you know that the testing of your faith ( G ) produces perseverance. ( H )

4.verse: Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature ( I ) and complete, not lacking anything.

5.verse: If any of you lacks wisdom, you should ask God, ( J ) who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to you. ( K )

6.verse: But when you ask, you must believe and not doubt, ( L ) because the one who doubts is like a wave of the sea, blown and tossed by the wind.

7.verse: That person should not expect to receive anything from the Lord.

8.verse: Such a person is double-minded ( M ) and unstable ( N ) in all they do.

9.verse: Believers in humble circumstances ought to take pride in their high position. ( O )

10.verse: But the rich should take pride in their humiliation—since they will pass away like a wild flower. ( P )

11.verse: For the sun rises with scorching heat ( Q ) and withers ( R ) the plant; its blossom falls and its beauty is destroyed. ( S ) In the same way, the rich will fade away even while they go about their business.

12.verse: Blessed is the one who perseveres under trial ( T ) because, having stood the test, that person will receive the crown of life ( U ) that the Lord has promised to those who love him. ( V )

13.verse: When tempted, no one should say, “God is tempting me.” For God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does he tempt anyone;

14.verse: but each person is tempted when they are dragged away by their own ( W ) evil desire and enticed.

15.verse: Then, after desire has conceived, it gives birth to sin; ( X ) and sin, when it is full-grown, gives birth to death. ( Y )

16.verse: Don’t be deceived, ( Z ) my dear brothers and sisters. ( AA )

17.verse: Every good and perfect gift is from above, ( AB ) coming down from the Father of the heavenly lights, ( AC ) who does not change ( AD ) like shifting shadows.

18.verse: He chose to give us birth ( AE ) through the word of truth, ( AF ) that we might be a kind of firstfruits ( AG ) of all he created.

19.verse: My dear brothers and sisters, ( AH ) take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak ( AI ) and slow to become angry,

20.verse: because human anger ( AJ ) does not produce the righteousness that God desires.

21.verse: Therefore, get rid of ( AK ) all moral filth and the evil that is so prevalent and humbly accept the word planted in you, ( AL ) which can save you.

22.verse: Do not merely listen to the word, and so deceive yourselves. Do what it says. ( AM )

23.verse: Anyone who listens to the word but does not do what it says is like someone who looks at his face in a mirror

24.verse: and, after looking at himself, goes away and immediately forgets what he looks like.

25.verse: But whoever looks intently into the perfect law that gives freedom, ( AN ) and continues in it—not forgetting what they have heard, but doing it—they will be blessed in what they do. ( AO )

26.verse: Those who consider themselves religious and yet do not keep a tight rein on their tongues ( AP ) deceive themselves, and their religion is worthless.

27.verse: Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after ( AQ ) orphans and widows ( AR ) in their distress and to keep oneself from being polluted by the world. ( AS )

1.verse: My brothers and sisters, believers in our glorious ( A ) Lord Jesus Christ must not show favoritism. ( B )

2.verse: Suppose a man comes into your meeting wearing a gold ring and fine clothes, and a poor man in filthy old clothes also comes in.

3.verse: If you show special attention to the man wearing fine clothes and say, “Here’s a good seat for you,” but say to the poor man, “You stand there” or “Sit on the floor by my feet,”

4.verse: have you not discriminated among yourselves and become judges ( C ) with evil thoughts?

5.verse: Listen, my dear brothers and sisters: ( D ) Has not God chosen those who are poor in the eyes of the world ( E ) to be rich in faith ( F ) and to inherit the kingdom ( G ) he promised those who love him? ( H )

6.verse: But you have dishonored the poor. ( I ) Is it not the rich who are exploiting you? Are they not the ones who are dragging you into court? ( J )

7.verse: Are they not the ones who are blaspheming the noble name of him to whom you belong?

8.verse: If you really keep the royal law found in Scripture, “Love your neighbor as yourself,”  ( K ) you are doing right.

9.verse: But if you show favoritism, ( L ) you sin and are convicted by the law as lawbreakers. ( M )

10.verse: For whoever keeps the whole law and yet stumbles ( N ) at just one point is guilty of breaking all of it. ( O )

11.verse: For he who said, “You shall not commit adultery,”  ( P ) also said, “You shall not murder.”  ( Q ) If you do not commit adultery but do commit murder, you have become a lawbreaker.

12.verse: Speak and act as those who are going to be judged ( R ) by the law that gives freedom, ( S )

13.verse: because judgment without mercy will be shown to anyone who has not been merciful. ( T ) Mercy triumphs over judgment.

14.verse: What good is it, my brothers and sisters, if someone claims to have faith but has no deeds? ( U ) Can such faith save them?

15.verse: Suppose a brother or a sister is without clothes and daily food. ( V )

16.verse: If one of you says to them, “Go in peace; keep warm and well fed,” but does nothing about their physical needs, what good is it? ( W )

17.verse: In the same way, faith by itself, if it is not accompanied by action, is dead. ( X )

18.verse: But someone will say, “You have faith; I have deeds.”

19.verse: You believe that there is one God. ( AB ) Good! Even the demons believe that ( AC ) —and shudder.

20.verse: You foolish person, do you want evidence that faith without deeds is useless  ? ( AD )

21.verse: Was not our father Abraham considered righteous for what he did when he offered his son Isaac on the altar? ( AE )

22.verse: You see that his faith and his actions were working together, ( AF ) and his faith was made complete by what he did. ( AG )

23.verse: And the scripture was fulfilled that says, “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness,”  ( AH ) and he was called God’s friend. ( AI )

24.verse: You see that a person is considered righteous by what they do and not by faith alone.

25.verse: In the same way, was not even Rahab the prostitute considered righteous for what she did when she gave lodging to the spies and sent them off in a different direction? ( AJ )

26.verse: As the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without deeds is dead. ( AK )

1.verse: Not many of you should become teachers, ( A ) my fellow believers, because you know that we who teach will be judged ( B ) more strictly. ( C )

2.verse: We all stumble ( D ) in many ways. Anyone who is never at fault in what they say ( E ) is perfect, ( F ) able to keep their whole body in check. ( G )

3.verse: When we put bits into the mouths of horses to make them obey us, we can turn the whole animal. ( H )

4.verse: Or take ships as an example. Although they are so large and are driven by strong winds, they are steered by a very small rudder wherever the pilot wants to go.

5.verse: Likewise, the tongue is a small part of the body, but it makes great boasts. ( I ) Consider what a great forest is set on fire by a small spark.

6.verse: The tongue also is a fire, ( J ) a world of evil among the parts of the body. It corrupts the whole body, ( K ) sets the whole course of one’s life on fire, and is itself set on fire by hell. ( L )

7.verse: All kinds of animals, birds, reptiles and sea creatures are being tamed and have been tamed by mankind,

8.verse: but no human being can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, full of deadly poison. ( M )

9.verse: With the tongue we praise our Lord and Father, and with it we curse human beings, who have been made in God’s likeness. ( N )

10.verse: Out of the same mouth come praise and cursing. My brothers and sisters, this should not be.

11.verse: Can both fresh water and salt water flow from the same spring?

12.verse: My brothers and sisters, can a fig tree bear olives, or a grapevine bear figs? ( O ) Neither can a salt spring produce fresh water.

13.verse: Who is wise and understanding among you? Let them show it ( P ) by their good life, by deeds ( Q ) done in the humility that comes from wisdom.

14.verse: But if you harbor bitter envy and selfish ambition ( R ) in your hearts, do not boast about it or deny the truth. ( S )

15.verse: Such “wisdom” does not come down from heaven ( T ) but is earthly, unspiritual, demonic. ( U )

16.verse: For where you have envy and selfish ambition, ( V ) there you find disorder and every evil practice.

17.verse: But the wisdom that comes from heaven ( W ) is first of all pure; then peace-loving, ( X ) considerate, submissive, full of mercy ( Y ) and good fruit, impartial and sincere. ( Z )

18.verse: Peacemakers ( AA ) who sow in peace reap a harvest of righteousness. ( AB )

1.verse: What causes fights and quarrels ( A ) among you? Don’t they come from your desires that battle ( B ) within you?

2.verse: You desire but do not have, so you kill. ( C ) You covet but you cannot get what you want, so you quarrel and fight. You do not have because you do not ask God.

3.verse: When you ask, you do not receive, ( D ) because you ask with wrong motives, ( E ) that you may spend what you get on your pleasures.

4.verse: You adulterous ( F ) people,  don’t you know that friendship with the world ( G ) means enmity against God? ( H ) Therefore, anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God. ( I )

5.verse: Or do you think Scripture says without reason that he jealously longs for the spirit he has caused to dwell in us  ? ( J )

6.verse: But he gives us more grace. That is why Scripture says:

7.verse: Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, ( L ) and he will flee from you.

8.verse: Come near to God and he will come near to you. ( M ) Wash your hands, ( N ) you sinners, and purify your hearts, ( O ) you double-minded. ( P )

9.verse: Grieve, mourn and wail. Change your laughter to mourning and your joy to gloom. ( Q )

10.verse: Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will lift you up. ( R )

11.verse: Brothers and sisters, do not slander one another. ( S ) Anyone who speaks against a brother or sister  or judges them ( T ) speaks against the law ( U ) and judges it. When you judge the law, you are not keeping it, ( V ) but sitting in judgment on it.

12.verse: There is only one Lawgiver and Judge, ( W ) the one who is able to save and destroy. ( X ) But you—who are you to judge your neighbor? ( Y )

13.verse: Now listen, ( Z ) you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will go to this or that city, spend a year there, carry on business and make money.” ( AA )

14.verse: Why, you do not even know what will happen tomorrow. What is your life? You are a mist that appears for a little while and then vanishes. ( AB )

15.verse: Instead, you ought to say, “If it is the Lord’s will, ( AC ) we will live and do this or that.”

16.verse: As it is, you boast in your arrogant schemes. All such boasting is evil. ( AD )

17.verse: If anyone, then, knows the good they ought to do and doesn’t do it, it is sin for them. ( AE )

1.verse: Now listen, ( A ) you rich people, ( B ) weep and wail ( C ) because of the misery that is coming on you.

2.verse: Your wealth has rotted, and moths have eaten your clothes. ( D )

3.verse: Your gold and silver are corroded. Their corrosion will testify against you and eat your flesh like fire. You have hoarded wealth in the last days. ( E )

4.verse: Look! The wages you failed to pay the workers ( F ) who mowed your fields are crying out against you. The cries ( G ) of the harvesters have reached the ears of the Lord Almighty. ( H )

5.verse: You have lived on earth in luxury and self-indulgence. You have fattened yourselves ( I ) in the day of slaughter.  ( J )

6.verse: You have condemned and murdered ( K ) the innocent one, ( L ) who was not opposing you.

7.verse: Be patient, then, brothers and sisters, until the Lord’s coming. ( M ) See how the farmer waits for the land to yield its valuable crop, patiently waiting ( N ) for the autumn and spring rains. ( O )

8.verse: You too, be patient and stand firm, because the Lord’s coming ( P ) is near. ( Q )

9.verse: Don’t grumble against one another, brothers and sisters, ( R ) or you will be judged. The Judge ( S ) is standing at the door! ( T )

10.verse: Brothers and sisters, as an example of patience in the face of suffering, take the prophets ( U ) who spoke in the name of the Lord.

11.verse: As you know, we count as blessed ( V ) those who have persevered. You have heard of Job’s perseverance ( W ) and have seen what the Lord finally brought about. ( X ) The Lord is full of compassion and mercy. ( Y )

12.verse: Above all, my brothers and sisters, do not swear—not by heaven or by earth or by anything else. All you need to say is a simple “Yes” or “No.” Otherwise you will be condemned. ( Z )

13.verse: Is anyone among you in trouble? Let them pray. ( AA ) Is anyone happy? Let them sing songs of praise. ( AB )

14.verse: Is anyone among you sick? Let them call the elders ( AC ) of the church to pray over them and anoint them with oil ( AD ) in the name of the Lord.

15.verse: And the prayer offered in faith ( AE ) will make the sick person well; the Lord will raise them up. If they have sinned, they will be forgiven.

16.verse: Therefore confess your sins ( AF ) to each other and pray for each other so that you may be healed. ( AG ) The prayer of a righteous person is powerful and effective. ( AH )

17.verse: Elijah was a human being, even as we are. ( AI ) He prayed earnestly that it would not rain, and it did not rain on the land for three and a half years. ( AJ )

18.verse: Again he prayed, and the heavens gave rain, and the earth produced its crops. ( AK )

19.verse: My brothers and sisters, if one of you should wander from the truth ( AL ) and someone should bring that person back, ( AM )

20.verse: remember this: Whoever turns a sinner from the error of their way will save ( AN ) them from death and cover over a multitude of sins. ( AO )
